verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. Maschil of David. Give ear<WH238> to my prayer<WH8605>, O God<WH430>; And hide<WH5956> not thyself from my supplication<WH8467>.
Attend <WH7181> unto me<WH6030>, and answer me<WH7300>: I am restless in my complaint<WH7879>, and moan<WH1949>,

Because of the voice<WH6963> of the enemy<WH341>, Because<WH6440> of the oppression<WH6125> of the wicked<WH7563>; For they cast<WH4131> iniquity<WH205> upon me<WH639>, And in anger they persecute me<WH7852>.
My heart<WH3820> is sore pained<WH2342> within<WH7130> me<WH367>: And the terrors of death<WH4194> are fallen upon me<WH5307>.
Fearfulness <WH3374> and trembling<WH7461> are come<WH935> upon me<WH6427>, And horror hath overwhelmed me<WH3680>.
And I said<WH559>, Oh that<WH5414> I had wings<WH83> like a dove<WH3123>! Then would I fly away<WH5774>, and be at rest<WH7931>.
Lo <WH5074>, then would I wander far off<WH7368>, I would lodge<WH3885> in the wilderness<WH4057>. <WH5542>[[Selah
I would haste<WH2363> me to a shelter<WH4655> From the stormy<WH5584> wind<WH7307> and tempest<WH5591>.
Destroy <WH1104>, O Lord<WH136>, and divide<WH6385> their tongue<WH3956>; For I have seen<WH7200> violence<WH2555> and strife<WH7379> in the city<WH5892>.
Day <WH3119> and night<WH3915> they go about<WH5437> it upon the walls<WH2346> thereof<WH205>: Iniquity also and mischief<WH205> are in the midst of it<WH7130>.
Wickedness <WH1942> is in the midst<WH7130> thereof<WH8496>: Oppression and guile<WH4820> depart<WH4185> not from its streets<WH7339>.

For it was not an enemy<WH341> that reproached<WH2778> me<WH5375>; Then I could have borne it<WH8130>: Neither was it he that hated me that did magnify<WH1431> himself against me<WH5641>; Then I would have hid myself from him:
But it was thou<WH582>, a man mine equal<WH6187>, My companion<WH441>, and my familiar friend<WH3045>.
We took sweet<WH4985> counsel<WH5475> together<WH3162>; We walked<WH1980> in the house<WH1004> of God<WH430> with the throng<WH7285>.
Let death<WH4194> come suddenly<WH5377> upon them<WH3381>, Let them go down alive<WH2416> into Sheol<WH7585>; For wickedness<WH7451> is in their dwelling<WH4033>, in the midst of them<WH7130>.
As for me<WH7121>, I will call upon God<WH430>; And Jehovah<WH3068> will save me<WH3467>.
Evening <WH6153>, and morning<WH1242>, and at noonday<WH6672>, will I complain<WH7878>, and moan<WH1993>; And he will hear<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>.
He hath redeemed<WH6299> my soul<WH5315> in peace<WH7965> from the battle<WH7128> that was against me<WH7227>; For they were many that strove with me.
God <WH410> will hear<WH8085>, and answer<WH6030> them<WH3427>, Even he that abideth of old<WH6924>, <WH5542>[[Selah The men who have no changes<WH2487>, And who fear<WH3372> not God<WH430>.
He hath put forth<WH7971> his hands<WH3027> against such as were at peace<WH7965> with him<WH2490>: He hath profaned his covenant<WH1285>.
His mouth<WH6310> was smooth<WH2505> as butter<WH4260>, But his heart<WH3820> was war<WH7128>: His words<WH1697> were softer<WH7401> than oil<WH8081>, Yet were they drawn swords<WH6609>.
Cast <WH7993> thy burden<WH3053> upon Jehovah<WH3068>, and he will sustain<WH3557> thee<WH5769>: He will never suffer<WH5414> the righteous<WH6662> to be moved<WH4131>.

But thou<WH430>, O God, wilt bring them down<WH3381> into the pit<WH875> of destruction<WH7845>: Bloodthirsty<WH1818> and deceitful<WH4820> men<WH582> shall not live out half<WH2673> their days<WH3117>; But I will trust in thee<WH982>.
